Compiled by the Venerable Avalokitavrata
Tripiá¹­aka Master from the Western Regions, Chao-san Ta-fuğŸ”½The realm of desire is like a dream,
Also like a mirage,
Fiercely blazing like a flame, the gods fall because of this.
If one gives rise to love for desire, one will be harmed later,
Crooked and not upright in thought, the gods fall because of this.
Extremely low, evil and detestable, flowing like the source of a river,
Compared to a deep and dangerous pit, the gods fall because of this.
The nature of desire is originally agitated, like wind, waves and the moon,
Like a snake's tongue that does not stop, the gods fall because of this.
Desire is like a flying lightning bolt, also like a mirage,
Like a bubble that is not solid, the gods fall because of this.
Desire is like a swiftly flowing river, like an elephant's ears that are always moving,
Like a plantain tree that bears fruit once and never again, the gods fall from their status.
Desire is like a magical performance, like the fruit of the kimpaka tree,
Like a fish swallowing a hook, the gods fall from their status.
One should use true wisdom to cut off the objects of desire,
Liberating oneself from unwholesome fruits and all that is unbeneficial.
Giving rise to deluded thoughts and delighting in desire,
One will be bound by the noose of desire, how can one's life be long?
The minds of sentient beings are fickle, all are dragged along by desire,
Foolish and ignorant, they deceive themselves.
If one is moved by the objects of desire, it is the root of all suffering,
Like a city of gandharvas, one should know it does not last long.
If one gives rise to greed for the objects of desire, hatred will follow along,
Thus, sentient beings quickly go to the evil destinies.
Therefore, those true men abandon desire and remove hatred,
Free from delusion and other faults, they manifest bright wisdom.
If one is disgusted with objects of desire, realizing them to be like deep enmity,
Using wisdom as a good friend, one will quickly realize the true and eternal fruit.
Not giving rise to attachment to desire, one attains freedom from all defilements,
This is being endowed with wisdom, and all the gods respectfully serve.
Skillfully transcending the mud of desire, one is able to bring happiness to sentient beings,
The mind free from bondage and tranquil, one subdues the armies of demons.
The fire of love arises in the mind, the deluded consider it cool and refreshing,
Yet it is superior to the fire of hell, this pervades the three realms.
Moreover, in that hell, one is able to give rise to the fire of the kalpa,
Extremely blazing and burning, all arise from love.
The suffering beings in hell, when their karma is exhausted, will certainly emerge,
The sentient beings in the three realms, the fire of craving has no rest.
Because they are bound by craving, they cycle without end,
How much more so in hell, where the fire of craving is born again?ğŸ”½Moreover, the karmic fire of hell
Can only burn their bodies,
The fire of craving harms sentient beings, burning their minds and bodies;
These two kinds of differences, I will now distinguish them,
Although the fire of hell is blazing, the fire of craving surpasses it.
Arisen from the three karmas, it burns everywhere in the three existences,
Harming the causes of goodness, only the fire of craving is poisonous.
The fire of craving burns the gods, the fire of anger is also so,
The fire of delusion follows the foolish, the fire of craving follows wherever it goes;
Jealousy and arrogance are also like fire, born from the fuel of self-grasping,
The fire of craving burns the world, constantly blazing without fuel.
Giving rise to longing and attachment towards objects, one is bitten by the snake of craving,
Gazing at and receiving with respect, it grows and increases.
Like fire that increases its fuel, it continues without end,
The fire of the world can still be prevented, but the fire of craving cannot be restrained.
If one is deceived by craving and follows the worldly flow,
Then it is like an enemy, and there is no one who can conquer it.
Covered by craving, one goes to the ocean to seek treasures,
Terrified in the midst of the army, one deeply enters and engages in battle.
The king loves his country, and so they encroach upon and compete with each other,
Even to the point of mother and child, disputes arise due to wealth.
If one is liberated from that craving and abandons all precious things,
Regarding them as worthless as tiles and pebbles, one then approaches the path of enlightenment.
Because of craving for wealth, one falls into the realms of hell,
That heat is difficult to endure, therefore one should stay far away from it.
One should use the water of wisdom to irrigate it and extinguish it forever.
If one does not extinguish the fire of craving, one will be far from enlightenment.
If one stays far away from craving, one will not be attached to any treasures,
Then that person will have no suffering at all in the world.
Just as a net catches fish, leaving behind all the shells and clams,
Craving binds those beings, there is none who can escape it.
Just as a deer poisoned by an arrow runs in the four directions,
The poison follows everywhere, how can one escape suffering?
The fire of craving is also like this, that poison always follows,
Burning the foolish and ignorant, by what means can one escape?
Temporarily giving rise to satisfaction, the karmic retribution always burns,
Those who seek the bliss of leaving the world should get rid of craving.
Just as a fish eats bait, they will certainly head towards death,
People are dragged by craving, there is no doubt they will die prematurely.
Falling into the realm of ghosts, they run around in torment everywhere,
And sentient beings in hell, mostly arise from the mind's craving.
Even going to others' doors, begging to make a living,
All are caused by craving, this is what the Buddha has said.
The fire of craving burns the gods, not needing any fuel at all,
Because of attachment to sense objects, it arises from the six sense faculties.
Experiencing complete bliss, always confusing and intoxicating the mind,
Falling without realizing it, mistaken by craving.
All the causes of cyclic existence, are obtained from craving,
The chain of craving restrains sentient beings, causing them to fall into evil destinies.
Moreover, the fire of craving in the heavens, the objects of desire always surround them,
Due to the power of delusion, they burn those attached to desires.
Just as fire, when encountering dry firewood, blazes even more intensely,
The pleasures of desire satisfy the mind, and their love grows even stronger.
Even though worldly fire is extremely fierce, people can all stay away from it,
But the fire of desire burns the world, and no one can escape its harm.
If a person does not give rise to love, they attain the utmost tranquility,
Escape from the dense forest of afflictions, and are able to transcend the ocean of suffering.
Free from the faults of union, they then cut off the bonds of desire,
Liberated from all sinful defilements, they are indeed those without sorrow.
For hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of kalpas, they are always deceived by desire,
Yet foolish people do not abandon it, bound by the net of illusions.
It is said that because they are covered by love, they enjoy being close to and serving [others],
Like a hired worker who drinks salty water when thirsty;
After drinking, thirst temporarily subsides, but soon the throat is dry again.
Thirst and craving reside in the mind - how can it be stopped by non-dharma?
Therefore, one should stay far away from it, as all evils arise from it.
Those subdued by craving sink and drown, without hope of escape.
Experiencing the most supreme and wonderful five desires of the heavens,
In the end, they are dragged by the rope of craving and fall back into the evil destinies.
If a person is close to craving, suffering and distress always fill their mind.
Relying on what is clearly stated in the scriptures, this is definitely not beneficial.
If one is attached to the objects of craving, there will be no satisfaction.
Those who can abandon craving are free from worries and troubles.
Because of craving, the gods give rise to negligence.
Addicted and attached, they pursue [craving] again, and later fall into hell.
When the gods lose [their status], it is the greatest shame.
Due to attachment to supreme bliss, one experiences extremely heavy suffering.
Love covers one's own mind, and the mind becomes agitated,
Not fearing the cycle of rebirth, indulging for a long time.
Sentient beings, due to the pleasure of desire, further increase their love,
The fire of love and the fire of hell, burning and harming each other.
If that love increases, it will continue endlessly,
Having already been born, one guards it, and what has not been obtained, one always pursues.
Because of giving rise to pursuit, the mind is always insufficient,
This person has no portion of bliss, as approved by the TathÄgata.
Because the mind is insatiable, one always thinks of the taste of desire,
Then one is burned by the fire of love, continuing to burn.
If one gives rise to fear towards desire, leaving the oppression of the fire of love,
Liberated from the defilements of love, one will not fall into evil paths again.
Due to one's own wrong thoughts, the dust of the three poisons arises,
Drowning in the deep abyss of indulgence, always greedy for the beauty of women,
Singing and music with wonderful sounds, giving rise to distraction,
The mind does not rest for a moment, just like a rushing river.
Love is like a deep and dangerous river, desire is like a leaky boat,
What fools ride in will sink and be lost.
Love is like a raging flame, the three poisons are like dry firewood,
Indulgence is like a swift wind, burning the gods without their noticing.
The gods attached to sensual pleasures are then subdued by love,
In a mere instant, not having a moment's leisure.
Love, based on desire, gives rise to a hundred thousand obstacles,
Because the gods are attached to pleasure, they are unable to do good.
The love snake has five heads, its nature is extremely violent and evil,
Stinging those greedy people, this suffering is difficult to endure.
The river of craving is extremely deep and wide, born from the five desires,
Those who wish to reach the other shore, without goodness, how can they cross?
Craving is like an illusory conjurer, filling the three existences,
Deceiving all gods and humans, with no benefit at all.
The five faculties grasp at desirable objects, never being content,
Like butter thrown into a fire, increasing moment by moment.
Moreover, that craving can open the door to the evil destinies,
Hell, hungry ghosts, and animals, thus constantly coming and going.
Foolish people, due to giving rise to craving, fall into the mouth of the demon of death,
Well able to avoid this fault, they are not devoured by him.
Those who possess wisdom can subdue that craving,
Free from worries, troubles, and fears, sitting and lying down always at ease,
If one is free from the bonds of craving, then suffering will not arise.
The foolish one often seeks, always causing harm,
In the daytime and at night, the mind does not give rise to compassion,
Wishing to take all the precious wealth of others.
This kind of person is like a fire, their nature is always violent and dangerous,
Far removed from good people, like a poisonous snake in a hole.
Due to excessive craving, one is burned by heat and distress,
After death, one falls into hell, and is reborn in the realm of hungry ghosts;
Having emerged from the evil destinies, one may be reborn among humans,
For five hundred lifetimes, one will always beg from others;
Having a low appearance and always speaking humbly, lacking and with a constricted mind,
Only suffering will be one's share, all due to craving.
If a person cuts off craving, always happily seeking the Buddha's wisdom,
This is the true person, who attains the supreme tranquility.
If you expel the love in the mind, like driving a snake out of a hole,
If the poison of love is not yet removed, you will certainly be destroyed.
If you definitely create, that love will always be present,
Like throwing fire into dry firewood, the flames will become more intense.
Beings crave precious wealth, accumulating it without satisfaction,
When their lives end, it all belongs to others.
Because of the faults obtained from love, wealth is scattered and sins are not eliminated,
Because of the pulling of karma, they go to hell with sorrow.
Wealth is enjoyed by others, but the crimes belong to oneself,
Falling into those evil realms, regretting in vain with hot distress.
The scattering of wealth is called decline, and the destruction of happiness is suffering,
Relatives suddenly become like enemies, all turning from the loving mind.
The wise do not give rise to desire;
The fire of desire always burns, harming all beings, causing them to fall into evil paths.
Accumulating wealth like a mountain, always guarding it with fear and worry,
How can one commit various crimes and use it unjustly?
Those who do not enjoy accumulating wealth have no fear and no need for protection,
This is the wise one who is free from greed, always abiding in peace wherever they are.
Those who enjoy seeking wealth and pleasure suddenly disperse and are destroyed,
Prosperity and decline do not last long, like the turning of the sun's wheel.
The prosperous are like those in bondage, the poor are like those with offenses,
All are driven by desire, with no aversion to desire.
Experiencing the highest wonderful pleasure, all desires are as one wishes,
Yet they are tormented by the fire of desire, bodily pleasure is all scattered and destroyed.
If the gods and humans are insatiable in their desires,
All are burned by craving, the TathÄgata knows and sees them all.
Hundreds of thousands of sentient beings, due to craving, fall into danger and difficulty,
And experience immeasurable suffering, the wise all sigh in admiration.
Life quickly passes away, foolish people do not know or awaken to it,
Meritorious karma is all exhausted, and that craving then increases.
If a person is attached to craving, it always follows them from life to life,
They are dull and ignorant, not understanding the characteristics of sin and merit.
If it is the result of good karma, one is born in the heavens and experiences joy;
Due to unwholesome karma, one falls from there.
Not creating good or evil karma, free from the faults of union and separation,
Abandoning the causes of old age and death, abiding in the highest peace and security.
Craving is like a chariot wheel, the five desires are the spokes,
Craving is in the center, the world does not know this.
The river of craving is extremely deep and wide, with the objects of desire as its waves and billows.
Doubt is likened to a school of fish, and in the world there are those who are ignorant.
During the three periods of day and night, one often creates unwholesome actions.
The wise do not guard against them, and then follow evil and transmigrate.
Beautiful form is like an illusion; understanding it, one is without bondage.
Because of craving, one always pursues it, and is bound without being able to be released.
If one is entangled by craving, one will then be attached to sensual pleasures.
If wisdom appears before one, it can remove those faults.
Craving increases its darkness, while wisdom gives rise to light.
One should abandon the dark and follow the light, leaving suffering and attaining peace and joy.
Wisdom is like a sharp sword that can cut down the trees of craving.
One should skillfully cultivate it and attain the highest peace and security.
One should know that the dense forest of craving is deep and difficult to escape from.
If a person can skillfully transcend, they will then transcend the three realms.
The river of craving has three branches, filled with the waters of heedlessness,
One should ride the boat of wisdom and be able to cross to the other shore.
Craving is like a sharp knife and staff, cutting the body of the foolish,
The suffering and distress are difficult to bear, therefore one should always stay far away from it.
Craving is like a malignant boil, arising from the mind,
In the midst of day and night, there is never a moment of joy.
Craving is like a raging fire, and doubt is like firewood,
Blown by the winds of karma, it burns the mind and gives rise to distress.
If a person is bound by craving, their mind will be restless,
Unreasonably taking others' wealth, they will lose their life and body.
The sentient beings in the world create boundless evil karma,
All due to craving for wealth, they long drown in the ocean of suffering.
Being driven by desire, they are brave and fearless,
Even stepping into fire, they do not care for their own lives.
If a person gives rise to much desire, the fire of the mind always burns,
Without the coolness of the intention of non-desire, it is like bathing in a deep pool.
Desire is like that raging fire, throwing fuel onto the blazing flames,
It is like that greedy person, getting more and more without being satisfied.
Endowed with immeasurable precious treasures, the ká¹£atriyas are still not content,
For the rest of sentient beings, keeping little is without trouble.
If a person gives rise to desire, happiness is little while suffering is much,
Suffering and happiness are both clearly manifest, the wise one skillfully takes and abandons.
One who skillfully subdues that desire attains the most supreme tranquility,
If one is able to always keep it at a distance, one is then close to the path of enlightenment.
Women are the root of offenses, able to scatter one's resources,
If one is subdued by them, how can there be happiness?
Women are often deceitful and always harbor jealousy,
Taking pleasure in creating unwholesomeness, having mastery over karma;
Using skillful words to deceive others, always giving rise to thoughts of harmony,
Lacking right mindfulness and contemplation, delighting in praising sensual desires.
They temporarily give rise to gentleness, but later often become harsh and cruel,
Even though adorned with precious and unusual ornaments, they never think of gratitude.
Even if hundreds of thousands of beings all give rise to affection,
Their nature is impermanent, just like a flickering lightning bolt.
If one delights in female beauty, it is an unwholesome cause,
Ruining both the present life and future bodies.
If one sees a single beautiful woman, the mind becomes scattered and agitated,
Delighting in and clinging to that object, being tormented by craving.
Union is sure to end in separation, and from it arises sorrow and grief.
Attachment constantly binds and entangles, all due to women.
This poison of desire for women arises simultaneously with the body,
Just as when fire is born in the world, heat exists along with it.
Know that this fire of desire is produced from the mind,
Continuously burning, with suffering having no equal,
Destroying good dharmas and harming sentient beings,
It is the cause of the evil destinies, as taught by the Buddhas.
Although the mouth speaks pleasant words, the mind always harbors poison,
In what it yearns for, its intentions are never fixed.
If it temporarily gives rise to love and attachment, it will soon abandon it,
What is said lacks sincerity, and its intentions are not real.
Using skillful means to deceive, due to the causes and conditions of indulging in desire,
And relying on this, they give rise to arrogance.
Celestials, humans, asuras, yakshas, ghosts, and spirits,
All fall into perilous difficulties, all due to women.
Moreover, those women do not know gratitude or virtue,
Their minds do not rest for a moment, like the sun revolving.
Seeing those who are prosperous, they delight in serving them,
If they have decline and danger, they have no little worry.
Like bees collecting flowers, when the flowers dry up they leave,
One should know that those women abandon the old in the same way.
Women have no compassionate mind, they always harbor jealousy,
This is not without a basis, it is all due to men.
Only women among the celestials, none else can subdue them,
Bound by the bonds of women, one then falls into evil destinies.
If one delights in and clings to women's beauty, this loss is unparalleled.
The fire of craving constantly burns the mind, how can one escape from it?
If one is dragged along by desire, greedy actions are all seen.
Always stupefying the mind, one delights in doing all that is unwholesome.
Women are bound by evil, often giving rise to hidden intentions,
Abandoning those they once cherished, like a snake casting off its skin.
Women are the most treacherous and deceitful, none can surpass them,
They often employ skillful means, hoping for favor and love.
Moreover, women by their very nature are often dissolute,
The wise have foresight, do not follow along with them.
If one becomes intimate with women, one will lose good benefits,
Even if seeking to be born in the heavens, this too will not be attained.
The wonderful sounds of joy in the heavens, all who hear them give rise to love,
If one delights in attachment and does not let go, it will lead to suffering and difficulty.
A woman's mind is fickle, giving rise to lust for others.
The fire of love may temporarily subside, but then she gives rise to abandonment.
A woman's resolve is firm, delighting in base acts.
If she sees him become decrepit, then she gives rise to abandonment.
Women are often deceitful, making him like a foolish deer.
Seeing him afflicted by misfortune, then she gives rise to abandonment.
Women are extremely treacherous and evil, not thinking of his kindness and virtue.
When disaster and difficulty befall him, then she gives rise to abandonment.
A woman's mind is scattered, giving rise to various thoughts.
She is able to deceive and entice others, like honey mixed with poison.
Women have many skillful words, able to confuse the foolish.

Due to delusion and attachment to desires, one is not stingy with wealth,
And does not cultivate the causes of blessings, like a rat always hiding.
Female form is like that rope, but it is the most firm and strong,
Binding those deluded men, causing them to fall into the ocean of the three realms.
That rope is not the substance of bondage, it only binds the mind,
If the mind is entangled by it, suffering then belongs to oneself;
Other ropes bind people, burning and cutting them all off,
But this female rope is not like that, it can pull one towards evil paths.
The body has its appearance and form, that rope can bind it,
The mind originally has no form or substance, it cannot be bound by a female rope.
If one is bound by a rope, its size is seen by all people,
But the female rope binds people, and the measure of this is unknown;
Temporarily giving rise to a little pleasure, later liberation is difficult,
Able to bind all sentient beings, they constantly sink in the ocean of suffering of desire.
Moreover, the rope of a woman skillfully binds the six sense faculties,
The rope of constant attachment has no such ability, it only binds the body and neck.
Wife, children, and relatives are the most firm bonds,
Foolish people give rise to false thoughts, all grasping them as their own.
Giving rise to love for the color of a woman, they are only sinews and flesh wrapped around,
A support for excrement and urine, your love comes here again.
Skillfully uttering clever words, deceiving and without shame,
One should know that a woman is no different from an enemy.
Using various wonderful adornments, causing others to give rise to love and joy,
Their minds are always restless, and their words are mostly false.
The nature of women is mostly poisonous, like a karavÄ«ra flower,
Harming those attached to desire, none can escape their difficulties.
Endowed with a hundred thousand skillful means, they cannot prevent women,
Just as wind, fire, and space cannot be bound by anyone.
Committing various non-disciplinary acts, encountering illness, difficulty, and premature death,
All due to women, destroying their practice of liberation.
The various sentient beings in the world, committing various sinful acts,
All due to women, with constant fear and oppression.
From youth to old age, their minds are always scattered and distracted,
The nature of women is inherently so, like sunlight is always warm.
The mind of a woman has no fixed principle, like the flame of a lamp in the wind,
With enmity, not abandoning for a moment, like a horse biting its wound.
Like a rope binding a weasel, although bound, it can still escape,
Then it is the same as that woman, not controlled by others.
Like a flower covering a poisonous snake, like ashes covering a blazing fire,
Just as form obscures the mind, like a woman concealing her foulness.
Just as a poisonous tree blooms, the observer is never sated,
This flower is like a woman, to be ultimately abandoned.
Always delighting in seeking women's forms, the objects of the senses immediately appear,
In this life and future bodies, there is no share of happiness.
Not fire, not sword or staff, not force or machinery,
Those bound by women, their evil cannot be severed.
In the human and heavenly realms, the faults of desire are briefly described,
If the wise one can distance himself, he will become the lord of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.
Those who delight in women's forms all arise from habitual tendencies,
In the world there are true people who are then able to avoid such things.
These people, with their past wholesome roots, having extinguished [their karma], are born among the gods,
Seeing the heavenly women, they are also distracted in the same way.
Then they slander and do not truly enjoy, and rebuke the mind that is not tranquil,
Disgusted with the faults of women, they leave as if they were enemies.
If one becomes intimate with women, many kinds of suffering arise,
Therefore one should understand and always keep away from them.
If one gives rise to a distracted mind, then faults arise,
Always seeing women, one gives rise to playfulness.
Japan has no darkness, and the nature of fire has no coolness,
Women have no compassionate mind, and a small part cannot be obtained.
The great earth has no tilting and shaking, and the nature of wind has no peace and tranquility,
Women have no good conduct, and always delight in speaking of faults.
Moreover, the mind of a woman is agitated and not long-lasting,
When there is difficulty, they abandon it, like geese leaving a dried-up pond.
Shallow waters are relied upon by egrets, but deep abysses have none,
The mountains and cliffs may quake, but they have no compassion.
Not praising the true Dharma, delighting in creating obstacles for demons,
Falling into danger and difficulty, deceived by them.
The blazing sun can be made cold, and grapes can be made hard,
But a woman's deceitful and jealous mind is firmly attached and cannot be abandoned.
In happiness, they enjoy it together, but in suffering, it is not so;
A little resentment always remains in the mind, and kindness is forgotten.
In the past, in the garden, we enjoyed ourselves together,
But when decline and difficulty suddenly encroach, we slander and abandon each other.
Women are the bonds of the world, increasing disputes and struggles,
A storehouse of faults, and a vessel of unwholesomeness.
Women's beauty deceives sentient beings, always harboring thoughts of desire,
Giving rise to conceptual pursuits, their minds never let go for a moment.
The arrows of immeasurable desire and love, Harming all sentient beings,
Where will that pleasure go?
All see it being ground to dust.
This desire is deeply to be feared, like a sharp knife or fierce fire.
The wise ones well understand this and always single-mindedly guard against it.
If one who upholds pure precepts suddenly gives rise to thoughts of desire,
It will invite immeasurable slander and give rise to many faults;
Just as when wind touches fire, the flames then blaze up,
Seeing a woman and giving rise to greed, one will certainly be burned by her.
If one seeks pure and blissful joy, one should stay far away from women,
In this world and in other lives, one's mind will always be tranquil.
Giving rise to courageous and vigorous effort, cultivating and practicing supreme wisdom,
Abandoning desire and believing in cause and effect, this person will attain great benefit.
This says that alcohol is poison, and one should stay far away from it,
If one delights in drinking alcohol, then one will destroy good dharmas.
If a person approaches alcohol, then wisdom will not arise,
They will have no part in liberation, therefore one should always stay far away.
It is said by the wise to be the foremost fault,
It harms oneself and others, therefore one should always stay far away.
If a person delights in drinking alcohol, they will enjoy speaking worldly matters,
With much speech, disputes will arise, therefore one should always stay far away.
Drinking alcohol destroys wealth, and one becomes confused and lazy,
Having such faults, therefore one should always stay far away.
Because of alcohol, greed arises, and so does anger,
It causes one to become increasingly foolish, therefore one should always stay far away.
Alcohol is the root of misfortune, causing the faculties to run wild,
Later falling into hell, all due to being ruined by alcohol.
Or speaking loudly and laughing boisterously, uttering violent and evil words,
Slandering good and kind people, later one will give rise to worry and fear.
Due to drinking alcohol and becoming confused, one cannot distinguish good from evil,
Like an animal lacking knowledge, therefore one should stay far away from it.
If a person is troubled by alcohol, confused and intoxicated, then they are like a corpse,
Seeking happiness and longevity, what benefit is there in causing harm?
This is the root of all difficulties, the source of all faults and problems,
Always dwelling in the midst of delusion and darkness, the steps leading to death;
Later falling into the hells, and being reborn in the realm of hungry ghosts,
And in the animal realm, all are destroyed by alcohol.
Alcohol is poison within poison, the chronic illness among illnesses,
Already suffering, and adding more suffering, this is what the wise ones say.
Destroying the life of wisdom, exhausting the treasures of the Dharma,
Slandering pure celibacy, all due to the mind's delight in alcohol.
Even those who are respected, once intoxicated, make no distinctions,
And are ridiculed by worldly people, yet feel no shame.
Alcohol is like a sharp axe, able to harm all wholesome dharmas.
Those who delight in drinking have no shame, and are despised by others.
If a person is deluded by alcohol, indulging without end,
Not performing any wholesome actions, they have no awareness or wisdom.
If a person delights in drinking alcohol, their mind becomes agitated,
Sometimes giving rise to laughter, sometimes to anger.
In this life and the next, ignorance always obscures wisdom,
Burning away the Dharma of liberation, all due to being controlled by alcohol.
If one craves the taste of alcohol, it is like eating a golden pomegranate,
Sweet at first but then poisonous, this is what the wise say.
Therefore, the wise ones deeply caution against alcohol,
The mind does not give rise to thoughts, drinking then produces distress.
The gods are always intoxicated with alcohol, even more so,
In those various pleasures, later they all disperse and are destroyed.
Beings are confused by alcohol, their minds are always intoxicated and disturbed,
They are dragged along by that delusion, attached to its delicious flavor.
Know that alcohol is like a rope, delusion and love are always difficult to untie,
It is better to fall into hell, one should not touch alcohol.
Because of touching, one smells its fragrance, the deluded person then delights in drinking,
Therefore, seeing that alcohol, one should abandon it.
If seen, greed arises, if touched, the fragrance is released,
Because of smelling that fragrance, the mind cannot be still.
Therefore, alcohol is a poison, giving rise to faults that are not one,
Destroying one's complexion, strength, and fame, all due to drinking alcohol.
Speaking nonsense, eyes rolling without a fixed direction,
Lying down at the wrong time, unaware, neglecting one's duties.
Rolling around on the ground, laughed at by women,
The body motionless, like a withered tree.
Drunk and lying down, suddenly seen as dead,
Those who know all say, Due to drinking alcohol, it is like this.
One who always delights in drinking alcohol abides in thirty-six faults,
